newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Dec 13.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Dec 13.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.

-- President Jacques Chirac in television interview last night said French people showed a reluctancy to change and excessive "conservatism". He defended the current franc-mark parity, and ruled out a government reshuffle.
-- Three unions at Credit Lyonnais sign agreement on shorter work week designed to avoid some of job cuts linked to a planned restructuring.

-- Bouygues to restructure its capital while buying from Saint-Gobain 80 percent of water supplier Cise to merge it with its own supplier Saur, plans to hold 83 percent of new company resulting from merger.
-- State-owned telecoms operator France Telecom plans to raise monthly subscription fees, lower domestic and international call rates ahead of a 1998 telecommunications deregulation.
